sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with ill-conditioned matrices
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations with the matrix:

$\begin{pmatrix} 1.01 & 1\\ 1 & 1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 2\\ 2 \end{pmatrix}$
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations, we can use the inverse matrix method. First, we need to find the inverse of the given matrix:

$\begin{pmatrix} 1.01 & 1\\ 1 & 1 \end{pmatrix}$

The inverse of a 2x2 matrix $\begin{pmatrix} a & b\\ c & d \end{pmatrix}$ is given by:

$\frac{1}{ad - bc} \begin{pmatrix} d & -b\\ -c & a \end{pmatrix}$

So, for our matrix, we have:

$a = 1.01, b = 1, c = 1, d = 1$

The determinant $ad - bc = (1.01)(1) - (1)(1) = 0.01$

The inverse matrix is:

$\frac{1}{0.01} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & -1\\ -1 & 1.01 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 100 & -100\\ -100 & 101 \end{pmatrix}$

Now, we can multiply the inverse matrix by the right-hand side vector to find the solution:

$\begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 100 & -100\\ -100 & 101 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 2\\ 2 \end{pmatrix}$

Performing the matrix multiplication:

$x = 100(2) - 100(2) = 0$

$y = -100(2) + 101(2) = 2$

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

$x = 0, y = 2$
